alert.note: Alert for Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 20 at 3:33PM MDT until March 23 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MDT TUESDAY ABOVE 8000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TUESDAY TO MIDNIGHT MDT WEDNESDAY NIGHT ABOVE 8000 FEET... * WHAT...For the first Winter Storm Warning above 8000 feet, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 7 to 14 inches with locally higher amounts possible. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the second Winter Storm Warning above 8000 feet, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 18 inches with locally higher amounts possible. Winds gusting as high as 75 mph. * WHERE...In Colorado, Uncompahgre Plateau and Dallas Divide. In Utah, La Sal and Abajo Mountains. * WHEN...For the first Winter Storm Warning, until 8 AM MDT Tuesday. For the second Winter Storm Warning, from noon Tuesday to midnight MDT Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility, especially on ridge tops and mountain passes. Very strong winds could cause tree damage. A detailed map of the snowfall can be found at: www.weather.gov/gjt/winter.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
